name: Infra-Red
wikiSummary: Infra-Red is the third single from Placebo's fifth studio album, Meds, and was released on 19 June 2006. The song peaked #42 in the UK, #35 on the US Modern Rock Tracks chart, and #91 in Germany.  The words "beggar's banquet", featured in its lyrics, references the Rolling Stones' album of the same name.  A live version of the song is available on the Live At La Cigale download-only EP.  The music video features politicians seemingly conspiring against the public; meanwhile, a group of ants interfere with their files.
wikiText:
Infra-Red is the third single from Placebo's fifth studio album, Meds, and was released on 19 June 2006. The song peaked #42 in the UK, #35 on the US Modern Rock Tracks chart, and #91 in Germany.
 
 The words "beggar's banquet", featured in its lyrics, references the Rolling Stones' album of the same name.
 
 A live version of the song is available on the Live At La Cigale download-only EP.
 
 The music video features politicians seemingly conspiring against the public; meanwhile, a group of ants interfere with their files. A character (apparently a president or similar leader) gives a speech with the help of a computerised prompter, but the ants' interference causes the prompter to say "I lied to you. We are the enemy", which the president reads.
